verbose_text: A number of additives found in lubricants have been shown to promote WSF occurrence, these include; extreme pressure (EP) and anti-wear (AW) additives consisting of sulphur and phosphorus compounds [XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR], where sulphur aids in hydrogen diffusion by preventing atomic hydrogen recombination [XREF_BIBR] and formulations of AW zinc dithiophosphates (ZDDP/ZnDTP/ZnDDP) with detergent / rust preventative calcium sulphonate additives [XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR - XREF_BIBR].
evidence: sulphur aids in hydrogen diffusion by preventing atomic hydrogen
